usage_rules.background: Use #09090B for main app background. Never use pure black #000000.
usage_rules.cards: Use #18181B with a 1px border of #27272A. No drop shadows in dark mode.
usage_rules.text: Headings in #FAFAFA. Body in #A1A1AA. Never use pure white #FFFFFF for body text (causes eye strain).

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. INSTALL FONTS: Add the Google Fonts import to index.css immediately.
2. CONFIGURE TAILWIND: Update tailwind.config.js with the colors and font families defined above.
3. LAYOUT STRATEGY: Use the 'Bento Grid' approach for the dashboard. Avoid equal-width columns where possible. Create density.
4. COMPONENT OVERRIDES: When using Shadcn components, override the default radius to 'rounded-md' or 'rounded-sm' for a sharper, more technical feel.
5. DATA DENSITY: This is a pro tool. Do not use excessive whitespace inside data tables. Keep it compact (py-2 px-3).
6. MICRO-INTERACTIONS: Add hover states to every interactive element. Use 'hover:bg-accent' for list items and table rows.
7. NOISE TEXTURE: If possible, add a fixed background div with a noise texture image and opacity-5 to give the app a tactile feel.
8. DATA-TESTID: Ensure all interactive elements have data-testid attributes.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur).
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style.
